docs.snippet: Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain met with senior cabinet members to discuss plans for Britain's departure from the European Union and its subsequent economic policy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain met with senior cabinet members to discuss plans for Britain's departure from the European Union and its subsequent economic policy.

docs.snippet: A reader writes that few people in Britain are aware of what the European Union actually does, and few care very much about it....
docs.lead_paragraph: A reader writes that few people in Britain are aware of what the European Union actually does, and few care very much about it.

docs.snippet: Scotland wants to stay in the European Union's single market after the United Kingdom leaves the bloc and will push for more  powers to protect its interests, the head of its pro-independence government said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Scotland wants to stay in the European Union's single market after the United Kingdom leaves the bloc and will push for more  powers to protect its interests, the head of its pro-independence government said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Scotland Wants EU Market Access, More Powers as UK Goes for Brexit
headline.print_headline: Scotland Wants EU Market Access, More Powers as UK Goes for Brexit

docs.snippet: Britain should take immediate action to safeguard the pre-eminent global role of its courts and legal services in resolving disputes over commercial contracts once Britain leaves the EU, a lobby group for the industry said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain should take immediate action to safeguard the pre-eminent global role of its courts and legal services in resolving disputes over commercial contracts once Britain leaves the EU, a lobby group for the industry said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Legal Firms Want Unilateral UK Action to Safeguard Sector After Brexit
headline.print_headline: Legal Firms Want Unilateral UK Action to Safeguard Sector After Brexit

docs.snippet: Sports Direct ended a tough 2016 with a warning that trading was not going to get any easier next year after a slump in first-half profit, sparking another fall in its shares....

headline.main: Sports Direct Warns Tough Times Ahead After Brexit Knocks Profit
headline.print_headline: Sports Direct Warns Tough Times Ahead After Brexit Knocks Profit

docs.snippet: British house prices hit a seven-month high in November and companies hired more workers, surveys showed on Thursday, suggesting the economy remained resilient five months after Britain's vote to leave the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: British house prices hit a seven-month high in November and companies hired more workers, surveys showed on Thursday, suggesting the economy remained resilient five months after Britain's vote to leave the European Union.

headline.main: UK Housing, Hiring Stay Resilient Despite Brexit Vote-Surveys
headline.print_headline: UK Housing, Hiring Stay Resilient Despite Brexit Vote-Surveys

docs.snippet: Outsourcing group Capita announced the sale of its asset management services arm alongside a second profit warning in three months on Thursday, exposing flaws in its strategy made worse by the Brexit vote and sending its share price crashing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Outsourcing group Capita announced the sale of its asset management services arm alongside a second profit warning in three months on Thursday, exposing flaws in its strategy made worse by the Brexit vote and sending its share price crashing.

headline.main: Capita Warns on Profit Again as Brexit Slowdown Exposes Flaws
headline.print_headline: Capita Warns on Profit Again as Brexit Slowdown Exposes Flaws

docs.snippet: A European Union plan to bolster its capital markets received a boost from two preliminary deals to revive the credit sector, EU officials said on Thursday, a sign that Britain's vote to leave the bloc may not hamper the project....
docs.lead_paragraph: A European Union plan to bolster its capital markets received a boost from two preliminary deals to revive the credit sector, EU officials said on Thursday, a sign that Britain's vote to leave the bloc may not hamper the project.

headline.main: Despite Brexit, EU Makes Progress on Capital Market Plan
headline.print_headline: Despite Brexit, EU Makes Progress on Capital Market Plan

docs.snippet: The referendum in which Britons voted to leave the European Union is not legally binding, the Supreme Court was told on Wednesday during a hearing on who has the power to trigger Brexit....
docs.lead_paragraph: The referendum in which Britons voted to leave the European Union is not legally binding, the Supreme Court was told on Wednesday during a hearing on who has the power to trigger Brexit.

headline.main: Brexit Referendum Not Legally Binding, Supreme Court Told
headline.print_headline: Brexit Referendum Not Legally Binding, Supreme Court Told
